main event: An unidentified object was observed in Mansfield Center, Connecticut on August 22, 1964, described as very bright white and sharply outlined, which blinked out of sight after a few seconds.
interesting points: The object was visible for a few seconds before disappearing suddenly., The witness reported seeing the object sway slightly as if affected by wind currents during a second sighting., The object was described as circular and brighter than the brightest stars., The witness initially thought the object was a jet due to its position before it began to move quickly., There was a subsequent reopening of the investigation based on the witness's reports.
witness description: The witness described seeing the object outdoors with a friend.
